thread.title: New Northern Powerhouse Minister 'not snubbing the North East' - despite tour omission
thread.title_full: New Northern Powerhouse Minister 'not snubbing the North East' - despite tour omission

author: Mike Kelly
title: New Northern Powerhouse Minister 'not snubbing the North East' - despite tour omission
text:
New Northern Powerhouse Minister 'not snubbing the North East' - despite tour omission 06:00, 27 Jul 2016 The first official tour of Andrew Percy on Wednesday takes in Hull, Liverpool and Manchester - but not the North East Shares Get daily news by email Andrew Percy, MP for Brigg and Goole, was appointed as the new Northern Powerhouse minister 
The Government has denied the new Northern Powerhouse Minister has snubbed the North East as he goes on his first tour in the job. 
Andrew Percy replaced James Wharton after Prime Minister Theresa May’s recent cabinet re-shuffle. 
And with the North East having put on hold devolution talks until more post-Brexit assurances are given by the Government, the region is conspicuous by its absence on Mr Percy’s official travel itinerary for Wednesday. 
Instead he has chosen Hull, Manchester and Liverpool on his first trip in his new role in which he will be accompanied by commercial secretary to the Treasury, Lord O’Neill. 
A spokesman for the Department of the Communities and Local Government said the omission should not be seen as a snub. 
He said: “The Minister has a very full diary. In the coming months he’s looking to get about and Newcastle is very much on his radar.” Dominic Salter Lord O'Neill of Gatley, Commercial Secretary to HM Treasury 
The Government says the trip is designed to “reaffirm” its commitment to building a Northern Powerhouse and that Lord O’Neill and Mr Percy, both “proud Northerners”, will build on the strong progress of the last two years. 
Mr Percy said: “Building the Northern Powerhouse is a long-term Government priority and central to our plans to rebalance the economy. 
“As a proud Northerner, I am determined to ensure that people in every part of the North – from large cities to small rural communities – enjoy greater control over their lives and stronger, more sustainable economic growth. 
“That’s why this Government will continue to support major investments to unlock the potential of the North and ensure that every area benefits from a growing economy.” Read More Labour plans a 'bank of the North' to provide massive infrastructure boost 
He said the trip will allow him to hear for himself how devolving greater power from Whitehall to Town Halls would stimulate economic growth. 
Mr Percy talked up the progress made already with the five historic devolution deals agreed in the North East, Tees Valley, Sheffield, Greater Manchester and Liverpool. 
But only this month the North East Combined Authority , made up of the region’s seven councils, put the devolution deal on hold following Britain’s vote to leave the European Union pending further assurances over funding in the aftermath of Brexit. 
However this has done nothing to dampen the upbeat message put out by the Government. 
Lord O’Neill said: “Making our great northern towns and cities a powerhouse for the economy once again is the reason I joined Government, and the Read More re is evidence everywhere you look that our plans have already made a real impact. Read More Government remains committed to North East devolution despite cabinet reshuffle 
“It is fantastic to be able to continue to champion the Northern Powerhouse within the very heart of Government and there will be no let-up in our commitment to fuel the local economy through encouraging foreign investment, improving transport and creating new jobs. 
“We know that our model to pull the region together is working, and we want other great regions across the country to consider how this approach could benefit them.”
